content:
• Thursday, January 25, 2018
  • SBBP

    Strongbridge Biopharma prices offering at $6.75/share

    • Strongbridge Biopharma (NASDAQ:SBBP) has priced its 5M-share offering at $6.75/share.
    • The stock had closed 8.3% lower during the regular session, at $7.20.
    • Underwriters got a 30-day option to buy up to 750,000 more ordinary shares at the offering price.
    • Gross proceeds are expected at $33.8M; net proceeds will be invested in commercial infrastructure for its two commercial products, Keveyis and Macrilen; development of clinical-stage products Recorlev and veldoreotide, and general purposes.
    • Shares were 2.1% lower after hours at last check.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/25/2018)

    • Top gainers: EGHT +8.7%. MXIM +4.7%. INTC +3.7%. KOS +2.2%. AVP +2.1%.
    • Top losers: SIVB -6.0%. WDC -4.7%. ISRG -4.1%. EQIX -3.3%. SBUX -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 14 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical Q4 top line up 11%; non-GAAP earnings down 8%; shares down 3% after hours

    • Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) Q4 results ($M): Total revenue: 892.4 (+10.7%); Instruments and accessories: 457.1 (+13.9%); Systems: 282.5 (-5.5%); Services: 152.8 (+4.1%).
    • Net Loss: (38.8) (-113.0%); non-GAAP net income: 297.7 (-8.1%); Loss/share: (0.35) (-113.7%); non-GAAP EPS: 2.54 (-8.3%).
    • Global da Vinci procedures up 17% driven primarily by U.S. general surgery and global urologic procedures.
    • Shipments of da Vinci systems: 216 (+32.5%).
    • Shares are off 3% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • WDC

    Western Digital -3.9% despite Q2 beats (update)

    • Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) shares are down 3.9% aftermarket following Q2 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates. Company will include guidance on the earnings call, which starts at 5:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Key metrics: Gross margin, 38%; cash from operations, $1.2B; cash and equivalents, $6.5B; total operating expenses, $1.1B; total liabilities, $18.6B.
    • Press release
    • Will update with guidance when available.
    • Previously: Western Digital beats by $0.16, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
    • Update:  Q3 guidance has revenue at $4.9B (consensus: $5B), EPS from $3.20 to $3.30 (consensus: $3.04), operating expenses at $840M to $850M, and gross margin from 42% to 43%.
    • FY18 guidance has EPS of $13.50 to $14 (consensus: $13.48).   
    • Western Digital shares are down 1.1% premarket on Friday.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 40 Comments
  • CE

    Celanese +3% on Q4 earnings beat; sees 10%-14% EPS growth in 2018

    • Celanese (NYSE:CE) +3.3% after-hours as Q4 earnings beat expectations and revenues rise 21% Y/Y, and the company offers a positive outlook for 2018.
    • CE says 2017 saw the company's second highest operating profit of $901M and record adjusted EBIT of $1.4B; in 2018 the company expects "the AEM pipeline model to evolve to a higher level of project volume and the Acetyl Chain to carry forward the momentum from its improved model."
    • CE expects 2018 adjusted EPS growth of 10%-14%, with more of the growth in H1.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel +4.5% on Q4 beats, data center growth, upside guidance

    • Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) shares are up 4.5% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates. The report marks the first since the highly publicized Meltdown and Spectre chip flaws.
    • In-line Q1 guidance: revenue, $14.5B to $15.5B (consensus: $15.03B); EPS, $0.65 to $0.75 (consensus: $0.72); operating margin, 27%; tax rate, 14%. 
    • Upside FY18 guidance: revenue, $64B to $66B (consensus: $63.79B); EPS, about $3.37 to $3.73 (consensus: $3.26); operating margin, 30%; tax rate, 14%. 
    • Segment performance: PC-centric Client Computing Group, $9B (-2% Y/Y); Data Center Group, $5.6B (+20%); Internet of Things Group, $879M (+21%); Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group, $889M (+9%); Programmable Solutions Group, $566M (+35%).
    • For FY17, the PC unit CCG had $34B in revenues (+3%) and Data Center Group had $19.1B (+11%), which returns Intel to strong data center sales growth on the year.
    • Cost cutting: Operating expenses were $5.4B in the quarter (-4% Y/Y) and $21.1B for the year (-9%). Intel plans to have operating expenses down to 30% of revenue by 2020 and the expenses were about 34% of revenue in 2017. 
    • Tax reform impact: Q4 reflects an income tax expense of $5.4B as a result of the tax reform. The non-GAAP tax rate for Q4 was 19.8%, up 1.4 points on the year. Company forecasts a 2018 tax rate of 14%. 
    • Earnings call at 5 PM Eastern with webcast available here.
    • Press release        
    • Previously: Intel beats by $0.21, beats on revenue (Jan. 25)
    • Previously: Intel declares $0.30 dividend (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 88 Comments
  • EGHT

    Comms firm 8x8 +7.1% after Q3 beats

    • Comms firm 8x8 (NASDAQ:EGHT) has jumped 7.1% after hours following fiscal Q3 earnings where it beat on top and bottom lines after growing service revenues 20%.
    • Mid-market and enterprise bookings rose 40% Y/Y.
    • “Additionally, we believe CIOs are increasingly demanding integrated enterprise communications solutions for their employees, customers and partners," says CEO Vik Verma. "Forty-nine percent of new monthly recurring revenue booked from mid-market and enterprise segments came from customers purchasing our integrated UCaaS and CCaaS solutions."
    • Non-GAAP gross margin was flat at 79% (service margin flat at 84%). Cash from operations was $8.2M.
    • ARPU for mid-market/enterprise customers rose to $4,765 from $4,412. ARPU per business customer was up to $454 from $414.
    • It's bumped up 2018 estimates: for revenue, it now expects $293M-$294M (16% Y/Y gain) vs. previous guidance of $292M-$294M, with service revenue at $278M-$279M (up from previous $275M-$277M).
    • It sees 2018 non-GAAP pretax net income at $9M, 3% of revenue.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • CE

    Celanese beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Celanese (NYSE:CE): Q4 EPS of $1.98 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $1.59B (+21.4% Y/Y) beats by $90M.
    • Shares +2.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • MATW

    Matthews beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Matthews (NASDAQ:MATW): Q1 EPS of $0.64 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $369.5M (+5.9% Y/Y) beats by $13.66M.
    • Shares +1.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks lower after comparable sales disappoint

    • Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) is down 3.6% in AH trading after comparable sales disappoint.
    • Global comparable store sales rose 2.0% during the quarter to fall short of the +3.0% consensus estimate. Transactions were flat during the quarter, while pricing added two percentage points of growth.
    • Global comparable sales by region: Americas +2%, China/Asia-Pacific, +1%, EMEA-1%.
    • Active membership in Starbucks Rewards in the U.S. increased 11% to 14.2M during the quarter. Starbucks Rewards member spend represents 37% of U.S. company-operated sales, and Mobile Order and Pay represents 11% of U.S. company-operated transactions.
    • The company's consolidated operating margin fell 80 bps to 19.2%. Operating margin in the Americas segment was down 100 bps to 23.0%.
    • Starbucks expects FY18 EPS of $2.48 to $2.52 vs. $2.48 consensus and $2.30-$2.38 prior guidance. Global comparable sales growth is expected to fall on the low end of the 3% to 5% guidance range previously issued.
    • Previously: Starbucks declares $0.30 dividend (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 82 Comments
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor beats by $0.24, beats on revenue

    • KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC): Q2 EPS of $1.97 beats by $0.24.
    • Revenue of $976M (+11.3% Y/Y) beats by $7.19M.
    • Shares +1.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • COF

    E*Trade tops estimates; buying 1M+ accounts from Cap One

    • Q4 net income of $129M or $0.48 per share includes mostly tax-related charges netting to $44M or $0.16 per share. Earnings one year ago were $127M or $0.46 per share. This quarter's adjusted EPS of $0.64 tops estimates by $0.03.
    • Alongside results, the company announces a deal to buy more than 1M retail brokerage accounts with $18B in assets from Capital One (NYSE:COF) for $170M. The deal is seen as relatively neutral to EPS this year, and about $0.06 accretive in 2019 once all synergies are realized.
    • Back to Q4: DARTs of 236K, a new record. Net new brokerage accounts of 46K; net new brokerage assets of $3.2B, bringing total to $383.3B.
    • 3.9M shares repurchased for $175M; average price of $44.97 each.
    • Conference call at 5 ET
    • Source: Press Release
    • ETFC -2.25% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 65 Comments
  • TER

    Stifel recommends investors buy Teradyne on selloff

    • Stifel reiterates its Buy rating and $54 price target for Teradyne (NYSE:TER) and recommends purchasing during the current post-earnings selloff.
    • Analyst Patrick J. Ho says Teradyne’s emerging robotics business remains a key long-term driver and the company should have another strong growth year. 
    • Ho attributes the company’s forecast to a possible timing issue related to the semi test business. Management said there was a four-week delay in the mobility market, which could push some test systems into the next quarter. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word 
    • Teradyne shares closed today down 4.2% to $44.80.     
    • Previously: Teradyne -6% despite Q4 beats, in-line guidance (Jan. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • INTC

    Intel beats by $0.21, beats on revenue

    • Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q4 EPS of $1.08 beats by $0.21.
    • Revenue of $17.1B (+4.3% Y/Y) beats by $760M.
    • Shares +2.4%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 53 Comments
  • EGLE

    Eagle Bulk Shipping +4% as Deutsche Bank starts at Buy

    • Eagle Bulk Shipping (EGLE +4.3%) enjoys strong gains after Deutsche Bank initiated coverage with a Buy rating and $7 price target, saying the company should benefit from positive trends in the dry bulk shipping sector.
    • The firm's positive outlook is built on expectations that cash flows will more than double in 2018 and earnings will grow more than 20%, reflecting recent vessel acquisitions and continued improvements in dry bulk rates.
    • Detusche Bank says dry bulk fundamentals have improved dramatically over the last year, with strong financial positions across the industry, thanks to continued improvement in rates and asset values.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple roundup: New self-driving vehicles join fleet, original content push gets new show

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has added 24 self-driving Lexus SUVs to its fleet since April 2017, according to the California DMV. 
    • The test fleet started off with three Lexus Rx450h SUVs receiving permits in April. 
    • Apple competes with Alphabet’s Waymo and Uber in the autonomous vehicle space.
    • More drama: Apple adds a drama series from La La Land director Damien Chazelle to its slate of original programming. 
    • Chazelle also has an upcoming show for Netflix but will write and direct every episode of his Apple project. 
    • Apple reportedly set aside $1B in its original content push and has already attracted the likes of Steven Spielberg, Reese Witherspoon, and Jennifer Aniston.  
    • Previously: Apple plans $1B original content investment; Taiwan blackout didn't impact suppliers (Aug. 16, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 30 Comments
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes is buying opportunity after two-day 9% loss, analyst says

    • Baker Hughes (BHGE -4.1%) extends yesterday's post-earnings losses, now more than 9% lower over the past two trading days as the GE albatross continues to weigh on the shares.
    • Analysts are weighing in today, mostly sticking with the company; Morgan Stanley analyst Igor Levi reiterates his Outperform rating and $44 price target, believing that the stock's weakness presents a buying opportunity, given that BHGE's free cash flow will soon inflect higher.
    • Wells Fargo's Judson Bailey also reiterates an Outperform rating, saying it saw solid execution in Q4 albeit overshadowed by underperformance in the Turbomachinery & Process Solutions unit and worries about GE.
    • Brad Handler at Jefferies continues to rate BHGE as a Hold, staying on the sidelines given worse than expected margins in the TPS business and competition that's weighing on pricing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • VIA

    Viacom, CBS jump on report boards will discuss re-merging

    • Viacom (VIA +2.7%, VIAB +2.6%) and CBS (CBS +1.3%) are on the move as Reuters reports the two companies are expected to discuss a potential re-merger at their next board meetings.
    • CBS chief Les Moonves and Viacom CEO Bob Bakish have had exploratory discussions about such a combination, according to the report.
    • The two boards have regularly scheduled meetings in the next couple of weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 7 Comments
  • ES

    Eversource’s Northern Pass proposal wins Massachusetts approval

    • Eversource Energy (ES +5.2%) spikes higher following news that the company's Northern Pass Transmission line was the sole winner of a 20-year renewable energy contract with the state of Massachusetts to deliver hydropower from Quebec.
    • The Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources says the project was selected from among dozens that had submitted bids under a 2016 state law that called for more renewable energy in the state.
    • ES plans to build a 192-mile transmission line from hydroelectric plants in Canada that will carry power through New Hampshire; a siting decision from the state is expected next month.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • F

    Ford bid down as investors get impatient

    • Ford's (F -4.7%) share price is in reverse again after the company's earnings report did little to swing investor sentiment back around.
    • The Ford conference call was also a little puzzling after CEO Jim Hackett told analysts they would have to "stand in line" to hear specifics on the automaker's mysterious "fitness redesign."
    • Evercore ISI sums up the Street vibe on Ford:"We didn’t hear anything from Ford which led us to believe life will get easier in coming quarters."
    • Sources: Ford earnings call transcript, Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 86 Comments
  • JAG

    Jagged Peak Energy -5% after RBC downgrade

    • Jagged Peak Energy (JAG -4.8%) sinks after RBC Capital downgrades shares to Sector Perform from Outperform, citing a tight frac service market in the Permian that lowers the firm's projected growth outlook.
    • RBC says JAG is "more susceptible to frac service constraints due to its smaller scale and being a relatively newer entrant."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (1/25/18)

    • Gainers: IIJI +15%. EMAN +15%. OHGI +10%. INSG +9%. MYSZ +9%.
    • Losers: SIFY -14%. SNCR -9%. NTNX -8%. AVX -8%. OTCPK:LBCC -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • HP

    Helmerich & Payne +3% as quarter shows strength in industry's 'sweet spot'

    • Helmerich & Payne (HP +3.2%) pushes higher after reporting better than expected FQ1 earnings and a 53% Y/Y revenue increase,
    • HP says its contracted U.S. land rig count rose ~4% to 204 by the end of the quarter compared to a slight decline in the industry rig count, with spot pricing continuing to rise by ~4%, resulting in an 11% increase in adjusted average rig margin per day.
    • Q2 revenue days are seen rising 1%-2% Q/Q, representing a 3%-4% increase in the average number of active rigs, given the lower number of calendar days during FQ2; average rig revenue per day is seen roughly flat to slightly up vs. FQ1.
    • HP also raises its 2018 capex budget to $350M, up from a previous range of $250M-$300M.
    • Analyzing the results, Bloomberg's Liam Denning says "HP is in shale's sweet spot," citing its ~40% share of active super-spec rigs, which offer more power, can drill longer horizontal wells and move quickly from well to well to speed things up.
    • "Having the rigs that the exploration and production industry needs means you can charge more, [which] came through" in the quarterly results, Denning writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Model 3 delays worsen - CNBC; shares fall 2%

    • Citing company employees as sources, CNBC reports battery production issues at Tesla's (NASDAQ:TSLA) Nevada Gigafactory are worse than previously owned up to.
    • The company is reportedly resorting to having some batteries made by hand, borrowing scores of workers form suppliers to assist with the manual assembly.
    • Roughly flat for the session prior to this report, shares are now down 2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 432 Comments

  • Trump trolling forex traders now

    • The dollar is going to get stronger and stronger, the president tells CNBC. Ultimately, he says, he wants to see a strong dollar. As for Treasury Secretary's Mnuchin's weak dollar words from yesterday, Trump says they were taken out of context.
    • The greenback has erased nearly all of the day's previously sizable losses following the comments.
    • Previously: Shrinking dollar just getting started - JPMorgan (Jan. 25)
    • Previously: Dollar's decline deepens after Mnuchin comments (Jan. 24)
    • ETFs: UUP, UDN, USDU
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 24 Comments
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences under modest pressure on new report from long-term bear Citron, shares down 3%

    • Exact Sciences (EXAS -2.7%) is down on more than 40% higher volume on the heels of a new report by persistent bear Citron Research.
    • Citron cites the competitive threat from liquid biopsies and slowing test volume growth for Cologuard.
    • Previously: Exact Sciences under pressure on potential CRC blood screening test; shares down 9% (Jan. 17)
    • Previously: Exact Sciences to expand capacity to 4.5M Cologuard tests/year (Nov. 8, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 36 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (1/25/2018)

    • Gainers: LOB +14%. SGLB +8%.RLI +6%. LMFA +6%. YIN +6%.
    • Losers: SIEB -11%. FSB -9%. IHT -7%. MBFI -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • ETII

    EnviroTechnologies International acquires CBD Health Co.

    • EnviroTechnologies International (OTCPK:ETII +51.4%) has acquired CBD Health Co. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
    • CBD Health Co. markets and sells high quality and proprietary hemp-based, natural CBD products.
    • The revenues from hemp-based CBD products in the US currently exceeds $200M.
    • “Our company has been successful in developing, testing and marketing safe, green and non-toxic product and equipment solutions for several industries. Our principals have years of experience in developing and marketing consumer cleaning products. Acquiring CBD Health Co. is a natural evolutionary step in our company‘s development as CBD Health Co. is a leader in the highly profitable and ever-growing CBD health supplement market,” said Randall Waters, ETI’s Vice President of Sales and Marketing.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (1/25/2018)

    • Gainers: LTBR +55%. FTK +9%. REXX +7%. WTI +7%. USAP +6%.
    • Losers: LPI -15%. RRC -10%. WWR -8%. NG -7%. CLF -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 9 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate topping as vice chairman says ready for consolidation

    • Shares in Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF.A +4.1%, LGF.B +3.3%) are up and hitting their highest point since share reclassification after its vice chairman indicated the studio is "very interested in the consolidation space."
    • Michael Burns says the company is talking to many people about merger prospects; "I could never say specifically," but likely partners include Verizon (NYSE:VZ), Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA), and Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN), CNBC says.
    • Consolidation in the media/telecom space, including big deals set between AT&T and Time Warner and between Disney and Fox, have raised the stakes for the remaining large-size independents, and Lions Gate is firmly in that space.
    • Burns says he "wouldn't pick a potential favorite partner" but highlighted all the business Lions Gate is doing with Amazon, including film releases The Big Sick and Manchester by the Sea: "We think there's more and more to do with them."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • DFS

    Discover gains 1.45% post-earnings; sell-side weighs in

    • via Bloomberg
    • Pleasing bulls like Morgan Stanley's Betsy Graseck, Goldman's Ryan Nash, and Wells Fargo's Donald Fandetti is better than hoped credit performance. Nash notes Q4 provisions of $679M were less than consensus of $740M, and Graseck says the 2018 outlook is inline-to-better than her estimates.
    • A variant view comes from Evercore's John Pancari, who's concerned about the expense outlook, continued pressure on credit costs, and competition hitting loan growth. He downgrades to Inline and cuts his PT to $80 from $82.
    • DFS +1.45%
    • Previously: Discover sees modestly higher charge-offs in 2018, slowing loan growth (Jan. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • MANU

    Manchester United signs Mourinho to extension

    • Manchester United (MANU -0.7%) announces the signing of manager José Mourinho to a contract extension out to at least 2020.
    • The soccer club won the Europe Cup last year in Mourinho's first year and qualified for the lucrative Champions League. The team is in good shape to stay in the Champions League as it now stands in 2nd place in the English Premiere League.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • TLND

    Talend -4.4% on analyst downgrade

    • JPMorgan downgrades Talend (NASDAQ:TLND) from Neutral to Underweight.
    • Latest analyst recommendations: 2 Buy, 4 Outperform, and 2 Hold. 
    • Median price target: $50. 
    • Talend shares are down 4.4% to $37.06.    
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • MRIN

    Marin Software -1.9% on restructuring plan

    • Marin Software (NASDAQ:MRIN) announces a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses to offset revenue decline and return to growth.
    • The plan includes cutting 48 employees or about 11% of the workforce. 
    • Marin expects to take pre-tax charges and costs of $1Mto $1.5M incurred primarily during Q1. The majority cash-based costs will go towards severance and termination benefits. 
    • Annualized cost savings estimated at $6M to $7M for 2018.
    • Marin Software shares are down 1.9%.
         
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • PM

    Philip Morris seen landing IQOS risk claim despite setback

    • Height Securities analyst Stefanie Miller thinks Philip Morris International (PM -2.2%) is likely to end up with FDA approval for its IQOS risk claim.
    • Miller says the advisory committee that ruled today was too "unprepared" and "inexperienced" to do anything but act as a roadblock. She also points out that the panel's recommendation is non-binding.
    • Philip Morris is looking for the modified risk tobacco product designation from the agency to help market IQOS products.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Philip Morris IQOS claims (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 27 Comments
  • MYSZ

    My Size +11.8 after regaining Nasdaq compliance

    • My Size (NASDAQ:MYSZ) announces receiving two letters from Nasdaq indicating the company has regained compliance with the minimum bid price and market value of listed securities rules.
    • Nasdaq says the company’s stock will continue to list and trade on the market.
    • My Size shares are up 11.8%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • GD

    General Dynamics +3% as BofA sees shares as undervalued

    • General Dynamics (GD +2.9%) extends yesterday's gains that followed its strong Q4 results, and the stock is seen as offering a compelling valuation vs. peers.
    • BofA Merrill Lynch reiterates its Buy rating for GD and raises its price target to $260 from $245, believing strong bizjet demand offers cyclical growth opportunities from defense and expectations from "stronger demand for large business jets, the defense upcycle and tax reform to provide strong organic growth."
    • The firm says GD's Q4 report showed strong orders for large cabin bizjet, contrary to the prevailing sentiment of weak demand, and expects the company to post 7.5% compounded annual growth for the aerospace business during 2017-21.
    • Shares have surged nearly 9% since GD's earnings release yesterday morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLS

    Celestica -6.1% after Q4, guidance misses on EPS

    • Celestica (NYSE:CLS) shares are down 6.1% following yesterday’s aftermarket earnings report. Q4 results met revenue estimates but missed on EPS.
    • Q1 guidance has revenue from $1.425B to $1.525B (consensus: $1.46B) and EPS from $0.20 to $0.26 (consensus: $0.28). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Celestica misses by $0.03, revenue in-line (Jan. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • OASM

    Oasmia Pharma follows through on breakout, up 32%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Oasmia Pharmaceutical AB (OASM +31.5%) joins the biotech breakout club on a 21x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 104K shares. Shares have rallied 50% since last week.
    • No particular news accounts for the action but at the end of fiscal 2017 (April 30, 2017) the company had only $3.5M in cash and equivalents. Operations consumed $16.4M during the year so the company is a prime candidate for a capital raise.
    • In early January, it secured a 108M SEK loan (US$14.04M).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers (1/25/2018)

    • Gainers: LTBR +53%. KTEC +50%. MNKD +36%. OGEN +35%. OASM +32%. IOVA +27%. CANF +20%. EMAN +19%. LYTS +17%. TAL +17%.
    • Losers: CFMS -34%. HZN -26%. NWL -22%. OCUL -17%. CCRC -13%. LPI -13%. IPWR -11%. VNRX -11%. VUZI -10%. SIEB -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • MNKD

    MannKind latest biotech breakout, up 32%

    • MannKind (MNKD +32%) is up more than a 5x surge in volume. Shares have rallied over 42% since Tuesday.
    • No particular news accounts for the action. Next Tuesday, CEO Michael Castagna will present an corporate overview at NobelCon14.
    • At the end of Q3 2017, the company had ~$20M in cash. Through the first three quarters, operations consumed almost $35M so the company will need additional capital to support the commercialization of Afrezza.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 40 Comments

  • Shrinking dollar just getting started - JPMorgan

    • The U.S. has been a "pacifist" in the currency war for too many years, JPMorgan Asset Management Chief Global Strategist David Kelly tells Bloomberg.
    • "Other countries - Japan and Europe - have been trying to push their currency down. We just took it. I think we shouldn’t." For improving the U.S. trade position, Kelly adds that he prefers a weaker greenback vs. "scary" tariff talk.
    • The dollar today is lower by about another 0.55% (depending on your favorite dollar index).
    • ETFs: UUP, UDN, USDU

  • ADXS

    Advaxis' lead candidate axalimogene filolisbac shows positive effect in early-stage anal cancer study; shares ahead 6%

    • Advaxis (ADXS +5.6%) is up on 30% higher volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing lead candidate axalimogene filolisbac (ADXS11-001), in combination with chemoradiation, in patients with high-risk, locally advanced squamous anal cancer. The data were just published in the International Journal of Radiation Oncology.
    • 90% (n=9/10) of treated patients experienced complete responses and eight of the nine (89%) remained disease-free at a median follow-up of 42 months. One patient progressed ~six months after completing treatment and subsequently died. Another patient died early in the study unrelated to therapy.
    • On the safety front, most adverse events (AEs) were mild/moderate cytokine-release-related (e.g., chills, headache, fever). Two subjects experienced Grade 3 (serious) treatment-related toxicities. All occurred within 24 hours of treatment and all resolved with standard care.
    • Clinical development is ongoing.
    • Axalimogene filolisbac is an immunotherapy based on the company's Lm Technology, which uses live attenuated bioengineered Listeria bacteria to deliver a fusion protein inside cancer cells which then stimulates the immune system to attack the cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 5 Comments
